snippet: Officials said they took the step to detain the teenager as a material witness out of necessity, but the girl’s lawyer said she was too scared to testify.
abstract: Prosecutors in Sacramento County, Calif, detain a 17-year-old girl for twice failing to appear in court to testify against the man accused of raping her; rare detention of a material witness has pitted law-enforcement officials against victims' rights advocates, who say it sets a dangerous precedent that will discourage others from coming forward.
lead_paragraph: Officials said they took the step to detain the teenager as a material witness out of necessity, but the girl’s lawyer said she was too scared to testify.

headline.seo: California Prosecutors Defend Detention of Teen Rape Victim
headline.main: Victims’ Advocates Protest as Prosecutors Detain 17-Year-Old Rape Victim in California
headline.print_headline: Victims’ Advocates Protest as Prosecutors Detain 17-Year-Old Rape Victim in California
